myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Sends the HELO command to the smtp server.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * This makes sure that we and the server are in
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * the same known state.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements from rfc 821: HELO <SP> <domain> <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE ERROR  : 500, 501, 504, 421
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Hello($host = '') {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so no confusion is caused
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:            "error" => "Called Hello() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    // if hostname for HELO was not specified send default
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(empty($host)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      // determine appropriate default to send to server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $host = "localhost";
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    // Send extended hello first (RFC 2821)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->SendHello("EHLO", $host)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if(!$this->SendHello("HELO", $host)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Sends a HELO/EHLO command.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  private function SendHello($hello, $host) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    fputs($this->smtp_conn, $hello . " " . $host . $this->CRLF);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $rply = $this->get_lines();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $code = substr($rply,0,3);

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($this->do_debug >= 2) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      echo "SMTP -> FROM SERVER: " . $rply . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($code != 250) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error =
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        array("error" => $hello . " not accepted from server",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_code" => $code,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_msg" => substr($rply,4));

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return true;

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Starts a mail transaction from the email address specified in
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * $from. Returns true if successful or false otherwise. If True
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * the mail transaction is started and then one or more Recipient
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * commands may be called followed by a Data command.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements rfc 821: MAIL <SP> FROM:<reverse-path> <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 552,451,452
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 500,501,421
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Mail($from) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so no confusion is caused
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "error" => "Called Mail() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $useVerp = ($this->do_verp ? "XVERP" : "");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    fputs($this->smtp_conn,"MAIL FROM:<" . $from . ">" . $useVerp . $this->CRLF);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $rply = $this->get_lines();

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($code != 250) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error =
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        array("error" => "MAIL not accepted from server",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_code" => $code,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_msg" => substr($rply,4));

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Sends the quit command to the server and then closes the socket
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * if there is no error or the $close_on_error argument is true.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements from rfc 821: QUIT <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 221
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE ERROR  : 500
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Quit($close_on_error = true) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so there is no confusion
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "error" => "Called Quit() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    // send the quit command to the server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    fputs($this->smtp_conn,"quit" . $this->CRLF);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    // get any good-bye messages
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $byemsg = $this->get_lines();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($this->do_debug >= 2) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      echo "SMTP -> FROM SERVER:" . $byemsg . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $rval = true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $e = null;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $code = substr($byemsg,0,3);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($code != 221) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      // use e as a tmp var cause Close will overwrite $this->error
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $e = array("error" => "SMTP server rejected quit command",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:                 "smtp_code" => $code,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:                 "smtp_rply" => substr($byemsg,4));
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $rval = false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        echo "SMTP -> ERROR: " . $e["error"] . ": " . $byemsg . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(empty($e) || $close_on_error) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->Close();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return $rval;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Sends the command RCPT to the SMTP server with the TO: argument of $to.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Returns true if the recipient was accepted false if it was rejected.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements from rfc 821: RCPT <SP> TO:<forward-path> <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250,251
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE FAILURE: 550,551,552,553,450,451,452
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE ERROR  : 500,501,503,421
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Recipient($to) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so no confusion is caused
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "error" => "Called Recipient() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    fputs($this->smtp_conn,"RCPT TO:<" . $to . ">" . $this->CRLF);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $rply = $this->get_lines();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $code = substr($rply,0,3);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      echo "SMTP -> FROM SERVER:" . $rply . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($code != 250 && $code != 251) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error =
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        array("error" => "RCPT not accepted from server",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_code" => $code,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_msg" => substr($rply,4));
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        echo "SMTP -> ERROR: " . $this->error["error"] . ": " . $rply . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Sends the RSET command to abort and transaction that is
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * currently in progress. Returns true if successful false
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * otherwise.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements rfc 821: RSET <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE ERROR  : 500,501,504,421
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Reset() {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so no confusion is caused
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "error" => "Called Reset() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Starts a mail transaction from the email address specified in
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * $from. Returns true if successful or false otherwise. If True
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * the mail transaction is started and then one or more Recipient
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * commands may be called followed by a Data command. This command
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * will send the message to the users terminal if they are logged
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * in and send them an email.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements rfc 821: SAML <SP> FROM:<reverse-path> <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 552,451,452
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 500,501,502,421
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function SendAndMail($from) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = null; // so no confusion is caused
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if(!$this->connected()) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:          "error" => "Called SendAndMail() without being connected");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    fputs($this->smtp_conn,"SAML FROM:" . $from . $this->CRLF);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $rply = $this->get_lines();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $code = substr($rply,0,3);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($this->do_debug >= 2) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      echo "SMTP -> FROM SERVER:" . $rply . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($code != 250) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $this->error =
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        array("error" => "SAML not accepted from server",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_code" => $code,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:              "smtp_msg" => substr($rply,4));

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * This is an optional command for SMTP that this class does not
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * support. This method is here to make the RFC821 Definition
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * complete for this class and __may__ be implimented in the future
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Implements from rfc 821: TURN <CRLF>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE SUCCESS: 250
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE FAILURE: 502
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * SMTP CODE ERROR  : 500, 503
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return bool
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  public function Turn() {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $this->error = array("error" => "This method, TURN, of the SMTP ".
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:                                    "is not implemented");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    if($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      echo "SMTP -> NOTICE: " . $this->error["error"] . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  * Get the current error

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  */

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * Read in as many lines as possible
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * either before eof or socket timeout occurs on the operation.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * With SMTP we can tell if we have more lines to read if the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * 4th character is '-' symbol. If it is a space then we don't
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * need to read anything else.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   * @return string
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  private function get_lines() {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    $data = "";
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    while($str = @fgets($this->smtp_conn,515)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if($this->do_debug >= 4) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        echo "SMTP -> get_lines(): \$data was \"$data\"" . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        echo "SMTP -> get_lines(): \$str is \"$str\"" . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      $data .= $str;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if($this->do_debug >= 4) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:        echo "SMTP -> get_lines(): \$data is \"$data\"" . $this->CRLF . '<br />';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      // if 4th character is a space, we are done reading, break the loop
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:      if(substr($str,3,1) == " ") { break; }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:    return $data;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.smtp.php:}

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:/**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * POP Before SMTP Authentication Class
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * Version 5.0.0
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * Author: Richard Davey (rich@corephp.co.uk)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * Modifications: Andy Prevost
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * License: LGPL, see PHPMailer License
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * Specifically for PHPMailer to allow POP before SMTP authentication.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * Does not yet work with APOP - if you have an APOP account, contact Richard Davey
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * and we can test changes to this script.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * This class is based on the structure of the SMTP class originally authored by Chris Ryan
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * This class is rfc 1939 compliant and implements all the commands
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * required for POP3 connection, authentication and disconnection.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: *
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * @package PHPMailer
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: * @author Richard Davey
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php: */

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Default POP3 port

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  public function Authorise ($host, $port = false, $tval = false, $username, $password, $debug_level = 0) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->host = $host;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  If no port value is passed, retrieve it
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($port == false) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->port = $this->POP3_PORT;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->port = $port;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  If no port value is passed, retrieve it
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($tval == false) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->tval = $this->POP3_TIMEOUT;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->tval = $tval;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->do_debug = $debug_level;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->username = $username;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->password = $password;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Refresh the error log
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->error = null;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Connect
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $result = $this->Connect($this->host, $this->port, $this->tval);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($result) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $login_result = $this->Login($this->username, $this->password);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if ($login_result) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        $this->Disconnect();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  We need to disconnect regardless if the login succeeded
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->Disconnect();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Connect to the POP3 server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $host
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param integer $port
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param integer $tval
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @return boolean
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  public function Connect ($host, $port = false, $tval = 30) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Are we already connected?
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->connected) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    /*
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    On Windows this will raise a PHP Warning error if the hostname doesn't exist.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    Rather than supress it with @fsockopen, let's capture it cleanly instead
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    set_error_handler(array(&$this, 'catchWarning'));
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Connect to the POP3 server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->pop_conn = fsockopen($host,    //  POP3 Host
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:                  $port,    //  Port #
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:                  $errno,   //  Error Number
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:                  $errstr,  //  Error Message
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:                  $tval);   //  Timeout (seconds)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Restore the error handler
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    restore_error_handler();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Does the Error Log now contain anything?
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->error && $this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->displayErrors();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Did we connect?
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->pop_conn == false) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      //  It would appear not...
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'error' => "Failed to connect to server $host on port $port",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'errno' => $errno,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'errstr' => $errstr
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      );
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if ($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        $this->displayErrors();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Increase the stream time-out
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Check for PHP 4.3.0 or later
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if (version_compare(phpversion(), '5.0.0', 'ge')) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      stream_set_timeout($this->pop_conn, $tval, 0);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      //  Does not work on Windows
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if (substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3) !== 'WIN') {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        socket_set_timeout($this->pop_conn, $tval, 0);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Get the POP3 server response
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $pop3_response = $this->getResponse();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Check for the +OK
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->checkResponse($pop3_response)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  The connection is established and the POP3 server is talking
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->connected = true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Login to the POP3 server (does not support APOP yet)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $username
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $password
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @return boolean
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  public function Login ($username = '', $password = '') {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->connected == false) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->error = 'Not connected to POP3 server';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if ($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        $this->displayErrors();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if (empty($username)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $username = $this->username;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if (empty($password)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $password = $this->password;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $pop_username = "USER $username" . $this->CRLF;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $pop_password = "PASS $password" . $this->CRLF;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    //  Send the Username
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->sendString($pop_username);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $pop3_response = $this->getResponse();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if ($this->checkResponse($pop3_response)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      //  Send the Password
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->sendString($pop_password);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $pop3_response = $this->getResponse();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if ($this->checkResponse($pop3_response)) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Disconnect from the POP3 server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  public function Disconnect () {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->sendString('QUIT');
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    fclose($this->pop_conn);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /////////////////////////////////////////////////
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  //  Private Methods
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /////////////////////////////////////////////////
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Get the socket response back.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * $size is the maximum number of bytes to retrieve
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param integer $size
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @return string
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  private function getResponse ($size = 128) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $pop3_response = fgets($this->pop_conn, $size);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    return $pop3_response;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Send a string down the open socket connection to the POP3 server
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $string
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @return integer
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  private function sendString ($string) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $bytes_sent = fwrite($this->pop_conn, $string, strlen($string));
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    return $bytes_sent;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Checks the POP3 server response for +OK or -ERR
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $string
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @return boolean
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  private function checkResponse ($string) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    if (substr($string, 0, 3) !== '+OK') {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      $this->error = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'error' => "Server reported an error: $string",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'errno' => 0,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        'errstr' => ''
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      );
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      if ($this->do_debug >= 1) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:        $this->displayErrors();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return false;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    } else {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      return true;
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * If debug is enabled, display the error message array
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  private function displayErrors () {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    echo '<pre>';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    foreach ($this->error as $single_error) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      print_r($single_error);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    echo '</pre>';
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  /**
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * Takes over from PHP for the socket warning handler
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @access private
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param integer $errno
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $errstr
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param string $errfile
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   * @param integer $errline
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:   */
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  private function catchWarning ($errno, $errstr, $errfile, $errline) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    $this->error[] = array(
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      'error' => "Connecting to the POP3 server raised a PHP warning: ",
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      'errno' => $errno,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:      'errstr' => $errstr
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:    );
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  }
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:  //  End of class
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/class.pop3.php:}

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<hr>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p>PHPMailer is the world's leading email transport class and downloaded an
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:average of more than 32,000 each month. In March 2009, PHPMailer was downloaded
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:more than 31,000 times -- that's an average of 1,000 downloads daily. Our thanks
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:to our new users and loyal users. We understand you have many choices available
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:to select from and we thank you for select our fast and stable tool for your
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:website and projects.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p>Credits:<br>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:PHPMailer's original founder is Brent Matzelle. The current team is:<br>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:Project Administrator: Andy Prevost (codeworxtech),
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<a href="mailto:codeworxtech@users.sourceforge.net">
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:codeworxtech@users.sourceforge.net</a><br>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:Author: Andy Prevost (codeworxtech) codeworxtech@users.sourceforge.net<br>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:Author: Marcus Bointon (coolbru) <a href="mailto:coolbru@users.sourceforge.net">
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:coolbru@users.sourceforge.net</a></p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p>PHPMailer is used in many projects ranging from Open Source to commercial
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:packages. Our LGPL licensing terms are very flexible and allow for including
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:PHPMailer to enhance projects of all types. If you discover PHPMailer being used
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:in a project, please let us know about it.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p><strong>WHY USE OUR TOOLS &amp; WHAT&#39;S IN IT FOR YOU?</strong></p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p>A valid question. We're developers too. We've been writing software, primarily for the internet, for more than 15 years. Along the way, there are two major things that had tremendous impact of our company: PHP and Open Source. PHP is without doubt the most popular platform for the internet. There has been more progress in this area of technology because of Open Source software than in any other IT segment. We have used many open source tools, some as learning tools, some as components in projects we were working on. To us, it's not about popularity ... we're committed to robust, stable, and efficient tools you can use to get your projects in your user's hands quickly. So the shorter answer: what's in it for you? rapid development and rapid deployment without fuss and with straight forward open source licensing.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:<p>Now, here's our team:</p>

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    Web design, web applications, forms: <a href="http://www.worxstudio.com">WorxStudio.com</a><br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      </p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>Our company, <strong>Worx International Inc.</strong>, is the publisher of several Open Source applications and developer tools as well as several commercial PHP applications. The Open Source applications are ttCMS and DCP Portal. The Open Source developer tools include QuickComponents (QuickSkin and QuickCache) and now PHPMailer.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      We have staff and offices in the United States, Caribbean, the Middle
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      East, and our primary development center in Canada. Our company is represented by
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      agents and resellers globally.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p><strong>Worx International Inc.</strong> is at the forefront of developing PHP applications. Our staff are all Zend Certified university educated and experts at object oriented programming. While <strong>Worx International Inc.</strong> can handle any project from trouble shooting programs written by others all the way to finished mission-critical applications, we specialize in taking projects from inception all the way through to implementation - on budget, and on time. If you need help with your projects, we&#39;re the team to get it done right at a reasonable price.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>Over the years, there have been a number of tools that have been constant favorites in all of our projects. We have become the project administrators for most of these tools.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>Our developer tools are all Open Source. Here&#39;s a brief description:</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <ul>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <li><span style="background-color: #FFFF00"><strong>PHPMailer</strong></span>. Originally authored by Brent Matzelle, PHPMailer is the leading "email transfer class" for PHP. PHPMailer is downloaded more than
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    26000 times each and every month by developers looking for a fast, stable, simple email solution. We used it ourselves for years as our favorite tool. It&#39;s always been small (the entire footprint is
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    less than 100 Kb), stable, and as complete a solution as you can find.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    Other tools are nowhere near as simple. Our thanks to Brent Matzelle for this superb tool - our commitment is to keep it lean, keep it focused, and compliant with standards. Visit the PHPMailer website at
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <a href="http://phpmailer.codeworxtech.com/">http://phpmailer.codeworxtech.com/</a>. <br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        Please note: <strong>all of our focus is now on the PHPMailer for PHP5.</strong><br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <span style="background-color: #FFFF00">PS. While you are at it, please visit our sponsor&#39;s sites, click on their ads.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        It helps offset some of our costs.</span><br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        Want to help? We're looking for progressive developers to join our team of volunteer professionals working on PHPMailer. Our entire focus is on PHPMailer
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    for PHP5. If you are interested, let us know.<br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        </li>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <li><strong><span style="background-color: #FFFF00">QuickCache</span></strong>. Originally authored by Jean Pierre Deckers as jpCache, QuickCache is an HTTP OpCode caching strategy that works on your entire site with only one line of code at the top of your script. The cached pages can be stored as files or as database objects. The benefits are absolutely astounding: bandwidth savings of up to 80% and screen display times increased by 8 - 10x. Visit the QuickCache website at
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <a href="http://quickcache.codeworxtech.com/">http://quickcache.codeworxtech.com/</a>.<br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        </li>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <li><strong><span style="background-color: #FFFF00">QuickSkin</span></strong>. Originally authored by Philipp v. Criegern and named "SmartTemplate". The project was taken over by Manuel 'EndelWar' Dalla Lana and now by "codeworxtech". QuickSkin is one of the truly outstanding templating engines available, but has always been confused with Smarty Templating Engine. QuickSkin is even more relevant today than when it was launched. It&#39;s a small footprint with big impact on your projects. It features a built in caching technology, token based substitution, and works on the concept of one single HTML file as the template. The HTML template file can contain variable information making it one small powerful tool for your developer tool kit. Visit the QuickSkin website at
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <a href="http://quickskin.codeworxtech.com/">http://quickskin.codeworxtech.com/</a>.<br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <br />
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        </li>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      </ul>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>We're committed to PHP and to the Open Source community.</p>

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    <p>Marcus is the technical director of <a href="http://www.synchromedia.co.uk/">Synchromedia Limited</a>, a UK-based company providing online business services. Synchromedia's main services are:</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:        <h2>Smartmessages.net</h2>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p><a href="https://www.smartmessages.net/"><img src="http://www.synchromedia.co.uk/uploads/images/smlogo.gif" width="292" height="48" alt="Smartmessages.net logo" /><br />Smartmessages.net</a> is Synchromedia's large-scale mailing list management system, providing email delivery services for a wide range of businesses, from sole traders to corporates.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      We pride ourselves on personal service, and realise that every one of your subscribers is a precious asset to be handled with care.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      We provide fast, reliable, high-volume delivery (some of our customers have lists of more than 1,000,000 subscribers) with fine-grained tracking while ensuring you stay fully compliant with UK, EC and US data protection laws. Smartmessages of course uses PHPMailer at its heart!</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    <h2>info@hand</h2>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p><a href="http://www.synchromedia.co.uk/what-we-do/info-at-hand-crm/"><img src="http://www.synchromedia.co.uk/uploads/images/infoathand-large.png" width="250" height="40" alt="info@hand logo" /></a><br />Synchromedia is the official UK distributor of <a href="http://www.thelongreach.com/">info@hand</a>, a class-leading open-source web-based CRM system. We provide licenses, hosting, planning, support and training for this very fully-featured system at very competitive prices. info@hand also uses PHPMailer!</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:    <h2>How can we help you?</h2>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>In addition to our headline services, we also provide consulting, development, hosting and sysadmin services, so if you just need a simple web hosting package, we can do that too. Not surprisingly, we know rather a lot about email, so you can talk to us about that too.</p>
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/aboutus.html:      <p>Please <a href="http://www.synchromedia.co.uk/about-us/contact-us/">contact us</a> if you'd like to know more.</p>

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:ChangeLog
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:NOTE: THIS VERSION OF PHPMAILER IS DESIGNED FOR PHP5/PHP6.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:      IT WILL NOT WORK WITH PHP4.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 5.1 (October 20, 2009)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed filename issue with AddStringAttachment (thanks to Tony)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed "SingleTo" property, now works with Senmail, Qmail, and SMTP in
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  addition to PHP mail()
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added DKIM digital signing functionality
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  New properties:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - DKIM_domain (sets the domain name)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - DKIM_private (holds DKIM private key)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - DKIM_passphrase (holds your DKIM passphrase)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - DKIM_selector (holds the DKIM "selector")
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - DKIM_identity (holds the identifying email address)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added callback function support
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - callback function parameters include:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    result, to, cc, bcc, subject and body
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  * see the test/test_callback.php file for usage.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added "auto" identity functionality
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - can automatically add:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    - Return-path (if Sender not set)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    - Reply-To (if ReplyTo not set)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - can be disabled:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    - $mail->SetFrom('yourname@yourdomain.com','First Last',false);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    - or by adding the $mail->Sender and/or $mail->ReplyTo properties
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  Note: "auto" identity added to help with emails ending up in spam
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  or junk boxes because of missing headers
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 5.0.2 (May 24, 2009)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Fix for missing attachments when inline graphics are present
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Fix for missing Cc in header when using SMTP (mail was sent,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  but not displayed in header -- Cc receiver only saw email To: 
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  line and no Cc line, but did get the email (To receiver
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  saw same)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 5.0.1 (April 05, 2009)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Temporary fix for missing attachments
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 5.0.0 (April 02, 2009)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* With the release of this version, we are initiating a new version numbering
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  system to differentiate from the PHP4 version of PHPMailer.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Most notable in this release is fully object oriented code.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Refactored class.smtp.php to support new exception handling
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  code size reduced from 29.2 Kb to 25.6 Kb
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Removed unnecessary functions from class.smtp.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function Expand($name) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function Help($keyword="") {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function Noop() {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function Send($from) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function SendOrMail($from) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  public function Verify($name) {
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:class.phpmailer.php:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Refactored class.phpmailer.php with new exception handling
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Changed processing functionality of Sendmail and Qmail so they cannot be
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  inadvertently used
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* removed getFile() function, just became a simple wrapper for
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  file_get_contents()
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added check for PHP version (will gracefully exit if not at least PHP 5.0)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:class.phpmailer.php enhancements
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* enhanced code to check if an attachment source is the same as an embedded or
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  inline graphic source to eliminate duplicate attachments
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:New /test_script
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* We have written a test script you can use to test the script as part of your
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  installation. Once you press submit, the test script will send a multi-mime
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  email with either the message you type in or an HTML email with an inline
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  graphic. Two attachments are included in the email (one of the attachments
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  is also the inline graphic so you can see that only one copy of the graphic
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  is sent in the email). The test script will also display the functional
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  script that you can copy/paste to your editor to duplicate the functionality.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:New examples
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* All new examples in both basic and advanced modes. Advanced examples show
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  Exception handling.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:PHPDocumentator (phpdocs) documentation for PHPMailer version 5.0.0
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* all new documentation
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Please note: the website has been updated to reflect the changes in PHPMailer
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:version 5.0.0. http://phpmailer.codeworxtech.com/
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 2.3 (November 06, 2008)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added Arabic language (many thanks to Bahjat Al Mostafa)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* removed English language from language files and made it a default within
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  class.phpmailer.php - if no language is found, it will default to use
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  the english language translation
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed public/private declarations
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* corrected line 1728, $basedir to $directory
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added $sign_cert_file to avoid improper duplicate use of $sign_key_file
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* corrected $this->Hello on line 612 to $this->Helo
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* changed default of $LE to "\r\n" to comply with RFC 2822. Can be set by the user
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  if default is not acceptable
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* removed trim() from return results in EncodeQP
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* /test and three files it contained are removed from version 2.3
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed phpunit.php for compliance with PHP5
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* changed $this->AltBody = $textMsg; to $this->AltBody = html_entity_decode($textMsg);
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* We have removed the /phpdoc from the downloads. All documentation is now on

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 2.1 (Wed, June 04 2008)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:** NOTE: WE HAVE A NEW LANGUAGE VARIABLE FOR DIGITALLY SIGNED S/MIME EMAILS.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:   IF YOU CAN HELP WITH LANGUAGES OTHER THAN ENGLISH AND SPANISH, IT WOULD BE
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:   APPRECIATED.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added S/MIME functionality (ability to digitally sign emails)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  BIG THANKS TO "sergiocambra" for posting this patch back in November 2007.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  The "Signed Emails" functionality adds the Sign method to pass the private key
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  filename and the password to read it, and then email will be sent with
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  content-type multipart/signed and with the digital signature attached.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fully compatible with E_STRICT error level
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - Please note:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    In about half the test environments this development version was subjected
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    to, an error was thrown for the date() functions used (line 1565 and 1569).
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    This is NOT a PHPMailer error, it is the result of an incorrectly configured
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    PHP5 installation. The fix is to modify your 'php.ini' file and include the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    date.timezone = America/New York
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    directive, to your own server timezone
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - If you do get this error, and are unable to access your php.ini file:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    In your PHP script, add
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    date_default_timezone_set('America/Toronto');
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    - do not try to use
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    $myVar = date_default_timezone_get();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:    as a test, it will throw an error.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added ability to define path (mainly for embedded images)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  function MsgHTML($message,$basedir='') ... where:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $basedir is the fully qualified path
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed MsgHTML() function:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  - Embedded Images where images are specified by <protocol>:// will not be altered or embedded
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed the return value of SMTP exit code ( pclose )
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* addressed issue of multibyte characters in subject line and truncating
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added ability to have user specified Message ID
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  (default is still that PHPMailer create a unique Message ID)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* corrected unidentified message type to 'application/octet-stream'
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed chunk_split() multibyte issue (thanks to Colin Brown, et al).

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:******************
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:A note on sending bulk emails:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:If the email you are sending is not personalized, consider using the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:"undisclosed-recipient:;" strategy. That is, put all of your recipients
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:in the Bcc field and set the To field to "undisclosed-recipients:;".
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:It's a lot faster (only one send) and saves quite a bit on resources.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Contrary to some opinions, this will not get you listed in spam engines -
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:it's a legitimate way for you to send emails.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:A partial example for use with PHPMailer:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:$mail->AddAddress("undisclosed-recipients:;");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:$mail->AddBCC("email1@anydomain.com,email2@anyotherdomain.com,email3@anyalternatedomain.com");
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Many email service providers restrict the number of emails that can be sent
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:in any given time period. Often that is between 50 - 60 emails maximum
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:per hour or per send session.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:If that's the case, then break up your Bcc lists into chunks that are one
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:less than your limit, and put a pause in your script.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:*******************
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:Version 2.0.0 rc1 (Thu, Nov 08 2007), interim release
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* dramatically simplified using inline graphics ... it's fully automated and requires no user input
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added automatic document type detection for attachments and pictures
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added MsgHTML() function to replace Body tag for HTML emails
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed the SendMail security issues (input validation vulnerability)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* enhanced the AddAddresses functionality so that the "Name" portion is used in the email address
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* removed the need to use the AltBody method (set from the HTML, or default text used)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* set the PHP Mail() function as the default (still support SendMail, SMTP Mail)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* removed the need to set the IsHTML property (set automatically)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added Estonian language file by Indrek P&auml;ri
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added header injection patch
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added "set" method to permit users to create their own pseudo-properties like 'X-Headers', etc.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  example of use:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->set('X-Priority', '3');
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->set('X-MSMail-Priority', 'Normal');
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* fixed warning message in SMTP get_lines method
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* added TLS/SSL SMTP support
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  example of use:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail = new PHPMailer();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->Mailer = "smtp";
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->Host = "smtp.example.com";
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->SMTPSecure   = "tls"; // option
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  //$mail->SMTPSecure   = "ssl";  // option
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  ...
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:  $mail->Send();
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* PHPMailer has been tested with PHP4 (4.4.7) and PHP5 (5.2.7)
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Works with PHP installed as a module or as CGI-PHP

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:and binary attachment are sent as is, base64 are encoded
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:* Can set Encoding to base64 to send 8 bits body
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/changelog.txt:through 7 bits servers

myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:		  GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:		       Version 2.1, February 1999
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE: Copyright (C) 1991, 1999 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:     59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE: Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim copies
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE: of this license document, but changing it is not allowed.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:[This is the first released version of the Lesser GPL.  It also counts
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE: as the successor of the GNU Library Public License, version 2, hence
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE: the version number 2.1.]
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:			    Preamble
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  The licenses for most software are designed to take away your
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:freedom to share and change it.  By contrast, the GNU General Public
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:free software--to make sure the software is free for all its users.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  This license, the Lesser General Public License, applies to some
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:specially designated software packages--typically libraries--of the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:Free Software Foundation and other authors who decide to use it.  You
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:can use it too, but we suggest you first think carefully about whether
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:this license or the ordinary General Public License is the better
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:strategy to use in any particular case, based on the explanations below.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom of use,
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:not price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:you have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:for this service if you wish); that you receive source code or can get
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:it if you want it; that you can change the software and use pieces of
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:it in new free programs; and that you are informed that you can do
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:these things.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  To protect your rights, we need to make restrictions that forbid
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:distributors to deny you these rights or to ask you to surrender these
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:rights.  These restrictions translate to certain responsibilities for
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:you if you distribute copies of the library or if you modify it.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  For example, if you distribute copies of the library, whether gratis
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that we gave
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:you.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the source
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:code.  If you link other code with the library, you must provide
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:complete object files to the recipients, so that they can relink them
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:with the library after making changes to the library and recompiling
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:it.  And you must show them these terms so they know their rights.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  We protect your rights with a two-step method: (1) we copyright the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:library, and (2) we offer you this license, which gives you legal
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:permission to copy, distribute and/or modify the library.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  To protect each distributor, we want to make it very clear that
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:there is no warranty for the free library.  Also, if the library is
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:modified by someone else and passed on, the recipients should know
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:that what they have is not the original version, so that the original
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:author's reputation will not be affected by problems that might be
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:introduced by others.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  Finally, software patents pose a constant threat to the existence of
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:any free program.  We wish to make sure that a company cannot
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:effectively restrict the users of a free program by obtaining a
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:restrictive license from a patent holder.  Therefore, we insist that
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:any patent license obtained for a version of the library must be
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:consistent with the full freedom of use specified in this license.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  Most GNU software, including some libraries, is covered by the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:ordinary GNU General Public License.  This license, the GNU Lesser
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:General Public License, applies to certain designated libraries, and
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:is quite different from the ordinary General Public License.  We use
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:this license for certain libraries in order to permit linking those
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:libraries into non-free programs.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  When a program is linked with a library, whether statically or using
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:a shared library, the combination of the two is legally speaking a
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:combined work, a derivative of the original library.  The ordinary
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:General Public License therefore permits such linking only if the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:entire combination fits its criteria of freedom.  The Lesser General
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:Public License permits more lax criteria for linking other code with
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:the library.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  We call this license the "Lesser" General Public License because it
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:does Less to protect the user's freedom than the ordinary General
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:Public License.  It also provides other free software developers Less
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:of an advantage over competing non-free programs.  These disadvantages
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:are the reason we use the ordinary General Public License for many
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:libraries.  However, the Lesser license provides advantages in certain
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:special circumstances.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  For example, on rare occasions, there may be a special need to
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:encourage the widest possible use of a certain library, so that it becomes
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:a de-facto standard.  To achieve this, non-free programs must be
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:allowed to use the library.  A more frequent case is that a free
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:library does the same job as widely used non-free libraries.  In this
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:case, there is little to gain by limiting the free library to free
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:software only, so we use the Lesser General Public License.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  In other cases, permission to use a particular library in non-free
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:programs enables a greater number of people to use a large body of
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:free software.  For example, permission to use the GNU C Library in
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:non-free programs enables many more people to use the whole GNU
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:operating system, as well as its variant, the GNU/Linux operating
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:system.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  Although the Lesser General Public License is Less protective of the
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:users' freedom, it does ensure that the user of a program that is
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:linked with the Library has the freedom and the wherewithal to run
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:that program using a modified version of the Library.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:  The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:modification follow.  Pay close attention to the difference between a
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:"work based on the library" and a "work that uses the library".  The
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:former contains code derived from the library, whereas the latter must
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:be combined with the library in order to run.
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:
myngl_myngl/PHPMailer/LICENSE:		  GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE
